at the music show.content: helplessly hoping was the song i was trying to remember that last night we stepped into reality knowing neil would carry the show to the next level of magic for the new year the new decade the new millennium the new medium and david was just happy to have survived and the spirit of the old days was the spirit of the new ways to say the same thing over and over and over again
I spent some time today improvising lyrics to a slow 4-chord progression. What fun!

Click on a post in the sidebar to view it.

My good friend Anne once ended a blog post with the question, “Anything you’ve learned from life so far you’d care to pass along?” That was a long time ago but I’ve finally gathered just a few answers:
something to behold
I’m tickled you’re here reading this. I may not know you nor get feedback but that’s okay. I still have a chance to touch you in some way with what I share – what could be better than that!
hehe
40 years later, looking back, I realize that little has changed.
i'll follow every lead

“**Share what you enjoy or what you're curious about.** Not everyone will enjoy of it, some people will appreciate different things, but build friendships on mutual interests. **Don't be afraid to say you don't know something. Being forthright and asking for help is an admirable quality.**”

We lived above the sub shop. My parents had opened one of area’s first, specializing in [Italian subs](https://ideas.joejenett.com/#sub), Philly steak sandwiches, Sicilian pizza, and other goodies. It’s not surprising I was a fat little kid back then.

not unique to me.content: - There are things I want to understand but never will and there are things I understand no one else would ever want to.
- I don't know how many times I've tried to start this thing.
a dip in cold water after days in the rough looking directly at the sun new days new ways to think about the same old things bugging me i wait for the chill to take over again and again
I want to deal with what’s possible, not wallow is what’s already taken place and left its ugly mark.
An odd example as if it was written by an angry misogynistic guy or something. I’m just saying...

that blues song in my head ever changing ocean breeze and clarity objects of my hunger as somewhere on river street a mime mesmerizes strangers looking for the void they misplaced looks on their faces telling life stories

I’m convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I’m living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don’t see, to what might be.

there’s things I need.content: So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
I got a thing to say
And you could have it all
and I know how to make one!
I’m trying to find my way back to what I was thinking just a moment ago.

My good friend Anne once ended a blog post with the question, “Anything you’ve learned from life so far you’d care to pass along?” That was a long time ago but I’ve finally gathered just a few answers:
How ’bout the fact that I’m here to write this – another chance to capture ideas – my days are numbered. Your’s are too. There’s nothing more cliché than *that’s life*.

helplessly hoping to free myself of this load helplessly grabbing for the next winning number in the stream of addiction the next spinning thunder in the noise of the same old thing over and over and over again

I see the web becoming a network of personal empires. In our own dominions, we say what needs to be said and share what we want to share. Here I am, glad to see so many people...so many empires.
My empire of dirt
surely the web is people

Apparently _those people_ aren’t really people. They’re like monsters getting ready to invade our country and rape our children. That’s the crap Donald’s been feeding people and millions are eating it up. Our country’s in a bit of a mess right now. I regret I was speechless at the time.

So this lady’s at our house a few weeks before Christmas and we’re talking. The conversation turns to her partner needing some rare medication that’s easier to get in Mexico. “We’re not sure about going to Mexico,” she says. “Okay, I know it’s a Trump thing and all but those caravan people are there.” Whoa!
because of it being that way.
So. Need to carry on and make the best of my time.
*   When someone starts with “I’m not a racist but,” they probably are.

We are connected. Each of our homes and neighborhoods give shape to a world we all live in. I need to see your empire. I want to know who you are. Even if it hurts.

I’m convinced the thought that fills my mind most of the time is just a complex of [reactions](reactions.md) to the strange world I’m living in. Creative [urges](urges-1.md) struggle to redirect my mind to what I don’t see, to what might be.
